alert.note: Alert for Kershaw; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lee, northeastern Clarendon, northern Sumter and south central Kershaw Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sumter County Airport, or 9 miles northeast of Shaw Air Base, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, Bishopville, Shaw Air Base, Oakland, Woods Bay State Park, Elliott, Mulberry, Lee State Park, Sumter County Airport, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Lucknow, Dalzell, Manville, Spring Hill, Cherryvale, Woodrow, Ashland, Ashwood, and Oswego. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 102 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 138 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
